rules.title: Respect and Professionalism
rules.description: All employees are expected to treat one another with respect and professionalism, regardless of position or role. Offensive language, harassment, and discrimination are strictly prohibited.

rules.title: Teamwork
rules.description: Employees are encouraged to promote teamwork by supporting and collaborating with colleagues.

rules.title: Confidentiality
rules.description: Confidential information concerning the company, its employees, or its clients must not be shared externally without authorization.

rules.title: Ethics
rules.description: Employees must uphold the highest standards of integrity and honesty in all work-related activities.

rules.title: Work Hours
rules.description: Employees are required to work from [10:30 AM] to [7:30 PM] with a designated [specified lunch break]. Punctuality is essential for maintaining productivity.

rules.title: Attendance
rules.description: Consistent attendance is expected. Absences should be reported in advance via the approved channels.

rules.title: Breaks
rules.description: Employees are entitled to [2] of [10 Minutes short breaks] per day, along with a [40 Minutes of lunch break].

rules.title: Remote Work
rules.description: Remote work may be permitted based on company policy and should be discussed with a supervisor in advance.

rules.title: Business Casual
rules.description: A business casual dress code is in effect unless otherwise specified.

rules.title: Exceptions
rules.description: Casual dress may be allowed on designated days or events, such as Fridays.

rules.title: Hygiene and Safety
rules.description: Employees are expected to maintain appropriate personal hygiene and dress standards for the office environment.

rules.title: ID Badges
rules.description: Employees must display their ID badges at all times while in the office. Lost badges should be reported immediately.

rules.title: Access Control
rules.description: Unauthorized individuals are not permitted in restricted areas. Visitors must sign in and be escorted by an employee.

rules.title: Data Security
rules.description: Employees are responsible for safeguarding company data. Ensure devices are locked when unattended.

rules.title: Internet Usage
rules.description: Office internet is provided for work purposes. Personal browsing should be kept minimal and appropriate.

rules.title: Equipment and Supplies
rules.description: Office equipment and supplies are company property and should be used responsibly.

rules.title: Personal Devices
rules.description: Personal devices may only be used in compliance with company policy, and sensitive information should be accessed only on approved devices.

rules.title: Internal Communication
rules.description: All employees are required to check emails and designated communication channels regularly.

rules.title: Respectful Tone
rules.description: Communications, whether via email, in person, or by phone, must be professional and respectful.

rules.title: Feedback and Reporting
rules.description: Concerns or suggestions should be directed to HR or management in a constructive manner.

rules.title: Workspace Safety
rules.description: Maintain a clean workspace free from hazards. Report any safety concerns to the office manager promptly.

rules.title: Emergency Procedures
rules.description: Familiarize yourself with emergency procedures, including the locations of fire exits and first-aid kits.

rules.title: Health Protocols
rules.description: Adhere to any health guidelines set by the company, especially during flu seasons or other health risks.

rules.title: Policy Violations
rules.description: Violations of office rules may result in disciplinary actions, including warnings, suspension, or termination, depending on the severity of the offense.

rules.title: Warning System
rules.description: A structured warning system will be in place, with specific steps taken for repeated violations.

rules.title: Appeals
rules.description: Employees may discuss or appeal disciplinary actions with HR if they feel necessary.

rules.title: Policy Acknowledgment
rules.description: All employees are required to sign a form acknowledging their understanding of and compliance with these rules.

rules.title: Policy Updates
rules.description: This policy may be updated periodically, and employees will be informed of any changes.

rules.title: Restricted Access
rules.description: Only employees and authorized personnel are permitted to remain within office premises. Visitors, family members, friends, or other non-employees are not allowed to sit or stay inside the office premises unless explicitly authorized.

rules.title: Visitor Sign-In
rules.description: Authorized visitors must sign in at the reception and be accompanied by an employee at all times during their visit.

rules.title: No Phones Allowed Inside Office Premises
rules.description: Visitors are not permitted to bring their phones into the main office area. Phones must be kept in a designated storage area or cupboard before entering the office premises.

rules.title: Responsibility
rules.description: Employees hosting visitors are responsible for informing them of this policy and ensuring compliance.

rules.title: Compliance and Security
rules.description: This policy ensures the privacy and security of company operations. Visitors should follow this procedure to avoid any interruptions or unauthorized access within the office. Employees are responsible for ensuring this policy is followed and must report any unauthorized individuals on the premises immediately.

rules.title: Unauthorized Presence
rules.description: Employees on leave or without prior permission are not allowed to remain within the office premises without the knowledge and approval of higher officials.

rules.title: Permission Requirement
rules.description: If an employee needs to visit the office during a leave period, they must seek prior approval from their immediate supervisor or designated higher official.

rules.title: Monthly Leave Allowance
rules.description: Employees are permitted a maximum of 2 leave days per month.

rules.title: Emergency Leave
rules.description: In case of an emergency, additional leave may be granted at the discretion of higher officials. Employees must obtain permission from a supervisor or designated higher official for any emergency leave beyond the standard allowance.

rules.title: Compliance
rules.description: Unauthorized presence in the office premises may lead to disciplinary action as per company policy.

rules.title: Assigned Seating
rules.description: Employees are required to sit only in their designated workstations or assigned areas within the office premises.

rules.title: Unauthorized Seating
rules.description: Employees are not permitted to occupy or work from other desks or workspaces unless prior permission has been granted by a supervisor.

rules.title: Compliance
rules.description: This policy is in place to ensure an organized and comfortable work environment. Unauthorized seating may result in corrective action as per company guidelines.

rules.title: Confidentiality of Login Credentials
rules.description: Employees must not share their login credentials (such as passwords and usernames) with anyone. These credentials are private and should be securely stored.

rules.title: Laptop Sharing
rules.description: Employees are not permitted to share their laptops or any company-provided devices with others without explicit permission from higher officials.

rules.title: Authorization Requirement
rules.description: If a situation arises where device or credential sharing is necessary, prior approval must be obtained from a supervisor or designated higher official.

rules.title: Laptop Locking Requirement
rules.description: Employees must lock their laptops whenever they leave their workstation, even if it’s for a short period. This ensures the security of company data and prevents unauthorized access.

rules.title: Compliance
rules.description: Failure to adhere to this policy may result in disciplinary action to safeguard data security and integrity.

rules.title: Daily Updates
rules.description: Employees are required to provide an end-of-day update on their work progress as per company guidelines. This helps maintain accountability and track project progress.

rules.title: Non-Compliance
rules.description: Failure to submit a work update at the end of the day, without a valid reason, will result in a deduction of one day’s salary.

rules.title: Exceptions
rules.description: In cases where an employee cannot submit their update due to unforeseen circumstances, they must inform their supervisor (before their logout) as soon as possible to avoid penalty.
